question:
World Bank has agreed to fund an economic corridor project through the Khyber Pass. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Khyber Pass lies on the India- Pakistan border.
  2. The Khyber Pass Economic Corridor project connects Pakistan and Afghanistan.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The Khyber Pass lies on the border between Pakistan and Afghanistan. It lies on the Spin Ghar Mountains which is also called the Indian Caucasus Range. It is noted point in the ancient silk road and formed a vital link between southern and central Asia. Statement 2 is correct:       The Khyber Pass Economic Corridor project is to link Pakistan and Afghanistan. It is expected to improve the economic well being of the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa region as well as reducing travel time between the countries. The link is to be 48km long and built at the cost of about 406 million USD.
